alert.note: Alert for Alamosa Vicinity, Central San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 6:33AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Rio Grande, southeastern Mineral and western Conejos Counties through 700 AM MDT... At 631 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 19 miles east of Pagosa Springs, or 21 miles north of Chama, moving northeast at 35 mph. These storms will track across the western part of the San Luis Valley HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
